channel.title: Port forward / adress already in use error
channel.description:
So when i open port 43594 i get this error when i run my server http://prntscr.com/5ngm17 and when i close the port and close utorrent and run my server it works fine and i get this http://prntscr.com/5ngmjv
Yes i am using utorrent to port forward i have an arris tg862 xfinty modem which makes it hard to port forward without utorrent
I am also using a lan connection from the modem
If anyone can help me and explain what the problem is and how to fix it please let me know
I am also using eclipse if that means anything to anyone..

item.title: Port forward / adress already in use error
item.dc:creator: @frostypanda frostypanda
item.description:
@frostypanda wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:548881”]utorrent sucks nuts when it comes to port forwarding…
Tbh you should try portforwarding normally, and skipping the utorrent step.

But, if you want to use utorrent…
Change the port to anything that is not port 43594.
Run your server.
Change the port on utorrent to 43594.
restart server.

It should work then, if not. Repeat everything, except the restart part.[/quote]

Thank you! i will try that now!

Edit: i got it to work it will now let me start my server up but i can not connect i am using a pi source so went into the client folder found client,java looked for string “server =” found it replaced the localhost with my no-ip http://prntscr.com/5ngwvh http://prntscr.com/5ngwx3
And when i check on canyouseeme my port 43594 is open
So what is my problem now and how can i fix it please and thank you!

Read full topic
item.source: Port forward / adress already in use error

item.title: Port forward / adress already in use error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

utorrent sucks nuts when it comes to port forwarding…
Tbh you should try portforwarding normally, and skipping the utorrent step.

But, if you want to use utorrent…
Change the port to anything that is not port 43594.
Run your server.
Change the port on utorrent to 43594.
restart server.

It should work then, if not. Repeat everything, except the restart part.

Read full topic
